issue.title: Appveyor builds have stopped triggering on GitHub
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3342](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3342). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Not sure what's going on, but this is in the last couple of days

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3342?focusedCommentId=16630249) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
I think they do trigger, but for some reason Github doesn't report their status:
https://ci.appveyor.com/project/ApacheSoftwareFoundation/arrow/history

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3342?focusedCommentId=16630254) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
I opened an issue here:
https://help.appveyor.com/discussions/problems/17150-github-doesnt-report-build-status-on-prs

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3342?focusedCommentId=16630899) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Feedback from the AppVeyor help desk:

> This is usually the problem with authentication. Can you please open https://ci.appveyor.com/account. revoke GitHub authorization and the re-authorize GitHub again.
> 
> What could happened, is that OAuth token got stale, or maybe user used to authorize AppVeyor left the organization and you need to re-authorize under different user.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3342?focusedCommentId=16630918) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
I opened a bug at INFRA. Let's see...
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/INFRA-17066
